intro: Sasanqua ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-leaf sasanqua, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to southern China and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with leathery, elliptical leaves that are glossy and dark green. Its flowers bloom in late autumn, adding ornamental value to gardens. Sasanqua ochroleuca is valued for its hardiness and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
